description: An iconic carry-handle-style sight from military AR-15s, such as the M16 and the M4.  This one is detachable and can be mounted as a regular sight.  Can only be installed on AR-15-style rifles.

variants.description: An iconic M16-style carry handle rear sight.  This model is Picatinny-mounted, designed to provide a familiar set of irons to soldiers while also being replaceable with reflex or optical sights.  As this is just a rear sight, it requires the common gas-block front sight found on AR-15-style rifles, and thus can only be mounted on those.  <variant:steel>

notes: width acquired from ImageJ-based width calculation, using partial width provided in the M4A1 technical data package
area and subsequently width may be somewhat incorrect, as they don't clearly align with the given dimensions in TC 3-22.9

//longest_side: acquired from Feret distance using ImageJ
//field_of_view: calculated as tangent of rear aperture diameter (0.07 in.) over sight radius (19.75 in.)
//sight_dispersion: calculated as tangent of front sight post width (0.075 in.) over sight radius (19.75 in.)

should we ever model a Block I CQBR, we should add it to the list
